text: Oba Ado (original Bini name was Edo) who reigned from 1630-1669 was the second Oba of Lagos. He was son of Ashipa, whom the Oba of Benin appointed as the first ruler of Eko. Ado's son, Gabaro was the third Oba of Lagos. ==Second Oba of Lagos== Ado collected yearly tributes from his subjects which in turn were remitted to the Oba of Benin as tribute. ==References== Category:People from Lagos Category:Obas of Lagos Category:History of Lagos Category:Yoruba monarchs Category:17th-century monarchs in Africa Category:17th-century Nigerian people Category:17th-century in Lagos
title: Ado (Lagos Oba)
